website_summaries.verdict: A versatile survival machete that is both corrosion- and rust-resistant.
pros: Features a titanium-bonded steel blade that remains sharp for an extended period of time
ABS handle is easy to grip
Comes with a nylon sheath for added convenience
A wonderful choice for camping, hiking and other outdoor excursions
cons: Saw may be too thick for some users
Less durable than many comparable options

customer_reviews.title: Great tool with many uses
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I have taken it hiking, camping, and used it around my house. It is strong, but not too heavy. The blade has hacked through 3 inch branches with minimal effort. The saw back is a little cantankerous because it seems to clog with wood if its not dry wood. It's a fantastic tool for bushwhacking. The little knife that comes with it is cool to. It could use a better handle but works all the same. I don't really feel the need to take another blade when I go on a hike, this thing has me covered well.
customer_reviews.author: M FN K

customer_reviews.title: A must carry on a riding mower for those pesky low hanging twigs and branches.
customer_reviews.text: Somehow, I was mowing my lawn and lost my older one in the lawn (I carry it on my mower to cut low hanging twigs and branches in my way). I think it fell through the floor of the mower. I searched for it, but could not find it. So, I just had to have another one. This is bigger and better...quite hefty. Love it! Now, I can cut bigger branches.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S. Wood

customer_reviews.title: 12 inch, not 18
customer_reviews.text: the knife is the one with the full tang (protruding from handle) but happily it is 12, not 18 as described. the others pictured with the camo handles (no tang protruding) are notorious for breaking at the handle on you tube videos--that may no longer be the case if they have made improvements ......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced and super sharp
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife. It has a full tang with a razor saw on the back. It showed up super sharp and well packaged. Comes with the mini harpoon attachment that you could use for fishing or gigging frogs. It has a great sheath to hold everything. The only thing I can say as a negative is the handle. It's great for dry hands, but any kind of sweat would make it hard to hold on to. Also, it would be nice if they offered the sheath as a left handed option as well. Overall I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Santy

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a work horse. Had one for years and still holding up. Got these for friends as gifts
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these at walmart years ago and is still holding up. Bought these as a gift for friends on a camping trip few weeks ago. Will cut through few inch thick branches and saw spine works get also.
customer_reviews.author: john t.

customer_reviews.title: Savage little thing
customer_reviews.text: I melted the handle off, because the ABS felt cheap, slick, didn't fit my grip particularly well. Prior to removing the handle, I would have given this machete maybe ....3.5 stars. After removing the handle, and simply wrapping a bit of grip tape around the tang instead, immediate 5 stars. I love chopping things up with this. Nicely weighted, feels sturdy, feels menacing but isn't out of hand.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Hunting

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son and it broke on the second time he used it, he’s ten years old and he wanted to cry but I told him it was not his fault so I’ll try a different kind
customer_reviews.author: lost collar

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for gardening plus.
customer_reviews.text: Took it out for yard work. Chopped away at pompos grass bush for 2 hours. Not impress with it's edge retention. It needed regular sharpening every 15 minutes. Handle was not comfortable for long use.
customer_reviews.author: HOMS

customer_reviews.title: bought as a gift
customer_reviews.text: bought this as a gift for a friend in our SAR team, even when I prefer a buck, SAK or simply a smaller blade, he's extremely happy with it, had tried it on many heavy duty tasks and presumes he loves it
customer_reviews.author: Martin Bermejo

customer_reviews.title: This thing is nasty. Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: I own several of these and so do all my camping/fishing buddies. Best bang for your buck. This thing is nasty. you wont be worry. Super strong, Super sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Franco

customer_reviews.title: if in question just get it
customer_reviews.text: i like camillus , low cost, full tang ,and no rust, holding an edge is soso , make sure you have a sharpener if your cutting things with it. nice and compact fits in my pack not hanging out unless thats what i want great either way. sheath is good enough i just use a little shoegoo on the edge so it doesnt cut through.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Dimille

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.text: Box showed another item, a small knife. That small knife was nowhere in the box. I know it comes with the little knife coz i purchased one from walmart sometime ago and it came with that little knife. Also, there is a little damage to the sheath. Looks like this item was a returned item. Vey disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dante Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp, nice improvement from previous design, both in the serrated edge and finally a lanyard hole!!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old loves this machete! Great for hacking in the woods! Like the brown plastic better than the tacky feel of the previous camo handle. Great to have a lanyard hole, and it can double as a blunt end to hammer, break glass etc.
customer_reviews.author: The Zeppelin

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent tool. Ladies
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tool. Ladies, you don't have to be Conan the Barbarian to wield this in thick brush.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: outstanding product, especially at the price there selling these for.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Good for light duty work.
customer_reviews.text: Came very sharp and seems to be holding an edge well. Worked great for light duty stuff, but the first day of heavy duty use and it came out with multiple warps. It did everything I asked, but the warps make it too dangerous for continued use except light duty stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Buy for camping and survival
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camping and survival tool. The saw back is awesome. Better than $100 survival tool
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller knife is also extremely sharp and very useful. Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp edge, just the right length too. Smaller knife is also extremely sharp and very useful. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Steele

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for what I use it for... Mostly fishing
customer_reviews.author: RawHyde

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Machete
customer_reviews.text: Came earlier then expected and looks and works just as described and pictured. very rugged
customer_reviews.author: drumgod87_1

customer_reviews.title: Good machete
customer_reviews.text: Good machete. A little heavy, and the blade comes a bit dull.
customer_reviews.author: Dred

customer_reviews.title: Nice Knife--slippery grip
customer_reviews.text: Quite the camp knife! Very versatile and high build quality. The small knife it comes with is handy for slicing fruit. The sheath is nice looking and sufficiently durable. Knife has some weight, which makes it good for chopping. The saw edge is also sharp and effective for cutting branches. The only improvement I would suggest is better traction on the grip--it is hard slippery plastic, and could slide out of your hand if you're swinging too wildly. 1 star penalty.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: what could be better, nice size and balance
customer_reviews.text: Knife with a saw, what could be better, nice size and balance.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Matthews

customer_reviews.title: ... only used this twice and each time I was pleased with how it worked
customer_reviews.text: I only used this twice and each time I was pleased with how it worked. I chopped to small trees whose branches leaned into my driveway. The blade never dulled or twisted. The saw edge works better than I thought it would. This machete is well worth it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McGee

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good but the sheath is a pain to snap closed
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, but
customer_reviews.text: I love it...but...the only place to press down when you are using the saw-tooth side of the blade, is against the cutting edge of the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Bill L.

customer_reviews.title: A "Big" Multi-tool for the Outdoors!
customer_reviews.text: Great multi-functional tool. I have yet to use all parts of it. Just the chopping, sawing, and cutting portions. Great for the camper or around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Have not used this instrument yet. Bought it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Have not used this instrument yet. Bought it for elk hunting this year. It is extremely sharp and well balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: A little rough with sloppy grinds on the gut hook. I had to regrind it. Great saw!
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Great large knife
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised at how nice this machete is. It came out of the box sharp enough to shave with. The back side serration is very aggressive. I've done a little batonning and, so far, it's held up well. I took one star off because the handle is a little small and is made of very cheap plastic. The sheath is decent. The small knife that came with it is just kind of a novelty, but could be used to fashion a spear in a survival situation. Once I get the handle situated the way I like it, this will definitely be my go-to large knife.
customer_reviews.author: TonyDad

customer_reviews.title: Grip is very slippery and blade is quite dull. Both small problems easily fixed
customer_reviews.text: Packaged was opened, I'm guessing this was a return. Grip is very slippery and blade is quite dull. Both small problems easily fixed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hulsey

customer_reviews.title: nice tool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep in my truck in case of emergency
customer_reviews.author: DLR

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent little machete
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent little machete. Only comment would be on its use. If you have it attached to a pack or on a belt there isn't an issue. If you hold the sheath in your hand and remove the blade with your other hand, beware of your hand placement. If you aren't paying attention you could potentially remove from skin/meat from your sheath hand with the serrations on the back of the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hand can slip off of grip far to easily and cause serious damage to user
customer_reviews.text: Sawback spine is dangerous to use. Hand can slip off of grip far to easily and cause serious damage to user. Either redesign the grip to provide better protection or eliminate the sawback spine. I would prefer the second option as my separate folding saw is far more efficient and less dangerous for sawing limbs.
customer_reviews.author: ca

customer_reviews.title: Have not had a chance to use it yet, ...
customer_reviews.text: Have not had a chance to use it yet, but seems to be well made, sharp and saw teeth apear to actually be usable.
customer_reviews.author: Rick McIntire

customer_reviews.title: Looks really cool for the money and is fairly sharp
customer_reviews.text: Looks really cool for the money and is fairly sharp, but the metal is really soft. Tried chopping a 1/2 inch limb and put a huge bite in the edge.
customer_reviews.author: robert s madrulli

customer_reviews.title: The grip feels comfortable the way it's molded
customer_reviews.text: I'm digging this blade. I got it to take on a weekend backpacking trip as an overall tool. The grip feels comfortable the way it's molded, I wore gloves when using it so I didn't have any problems with it rotating. The saw teeth are sharp and spaced in a way that works well. My blade came plenty sharp out of the box, I did have to sharpen the small knife though. I didn't use it for prying anything up, but the blade seems sturdy enough to be used as a pry bar. The sheath has a hard plastic insert to stop the blade from cutting the fabric. Overall a nice addition to the collection.
customer_reviews.author: Darin Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! I bought it for a gift and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Product! I bought it for a gift and now I want one.
customer_reviews.author: don bradley

customer_reviews.title: Not a flimsy blade!
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this machete is very good indeed. The added blade is of questionable value to me as it is not good for throwing, only for cutting and iusing the two hex holes in the handle for use on unspecified fastener sizes. My only disappointment was the confusion in my mind regarding the length. This machete is 18" overall length sporting a 12" blade.. I was expecting an 18" blade but that was my error. The heft is good and the blade is thick and rigid just as I thought it would be. Overall it is a good value for the money and I am sorely tempted to acquire the longer version at some future time.
customer_reviews.author: Packrat

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome look razor sharp and the mini knife it comes with is even sweeter great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a machine!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had one of these back in the 70's and 80's. I am pushing 60 now and cannot get out like I used too. But when I do, this will be going with me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Camillus Carnivore X - 18" Machete with Sheath, Titanium Bonded Blade, and Ballistic Nylon Sheath, Black, Grey (19236)
product_meta.description: The Camillus CARNIVORE X 18" Titanium Bonded Machete a multi-purpose machete designed to cut, dig, saw, chisel, and gut for all of your needs. The 12” blade is Titanium Bonded which is up to 3x harder than untreated steel ensuring that your blade stays sharper longer. Included with the Carnivore X is a Ballistic Nylon Sheath, and a removable trimming knife with its own nylon sheath. This is the perfect machete for hunting, camping, hiking, and exploring. Lifetime Warranty.
feature_bullets: DIMENSIONS: The full length is 18-inch; Blade length is 12-inch long, Saw Length 10"
BLADE TREATMENT: This 18 inch machete is full tang blade that uses Titanium Bonded 420 Stainless Steel.
Durable: A grippy texture is added to the handle to provide confidence while using.
Bonus Knife: Camillus Carnivore machete come with an bonus 5" skeletonized trimming knife with 7 & 9mm Hex Heads. A small nylon sheath can be attached to the machete sheath or used on its own.

Safety Feature: The included ballistic nylon sheath is thick, tough, synthetic nylon fabric that protects against debris and other foreign materials. This sheath features a belt loop for convenient and easy carrying.
